item.title: White Sands National Park
item.description: Rising from the heart of the Tularosa Basin is one of the world's great natural wonders - the glistening white sands of New Mexico. Great wave-like dunes of gypsum sand have engulfed 275 square miles of desert, creating the world's largest gypsum dunefield. White Sands National Park preserves a major portion of this unique dunefield, along with the plants and animals that live here.
item.author: Andrea Harrell / Tandem Stilles + Motion

item.title: Verdi: Aida
item.description: Aida is a four-act opera written by Verdi in 1870. Through the moving aria and ensemble, the magnificent chorus, the magnificent orchestra and the exquisite dance scene, it describes a touching love story in the pharaonic era of ancient Egypt about 3000 years ago.
item.author: EMI Classics

item.title: Xujiahui Park In Winter
item.description: Passing through Xujiahui Park, the beech trees on both sides of the main road have fallen leaves, which looks bare compared with the camphor trees nearby.
item.author: Homecat
